definition: to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: Wings to fly away and excercise what's been taught them.
sentences.chinese: 翅膀讓他展翅高飛並且運用所學的知識。

sentences.english: We fly together, leapt to the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 我們攜手展翅高飛，躍上雲端。

sentences.english: "Peng" symbolizes the fly, for the future.
sentences.chinese: “鵬”象徵着展翅高飛，前程似錦。

sentences.english: Only then, can the group soar high and overcome any difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 只有如許，一個組合才能降服重重堅苦，展翅高飛。

sentences.english: May our love soar on the wings of a dove in flight.
sentences.chinese: 願我們的愛乘着飛翔的白鴿，展翅高飛。

sentences.english: May your love soar on the wings of a dove in flight.
sentences.chinese: 鴯羜願你的愛乘着飛翔的白鴿，展翅高飛。

sentences.english: Only with him can my heart fly high.
sentences.chinese: 只有和他在一起，我的心才能展翅高飛。

sentences.english: Sometimes dream soaring above the earth like a roc.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，夢想像鯤鵬一樣，展翅高飛。

sentences.english: And may you always have the courage to spread your wings and fly.
sentences.chinese: 也希望你永遠擁有展翅高飛的勇氣。

sentences.english: One of his prints is called "For Ascending Larks".
sentences.chinese: 其中一幅叫做“致展翅高飛的雲雀”。

sentences.english: We are each of angels with only one wing, and we can only fly by embracing one another.
sentences.chinese: 我們是一對單翼天使，惟有緊緊相擁才能展翅高飛。

sentences.english: So long as he is full-fledged he will soar to great heights.
sentences.chinese: 只要羽翼豐滿，他就展翅高飛。

definition: to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
out with the old and in with the new (idiom)
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
